title: A Flavorful Twist on Classic Chili for Family Gatherings

description: Experience the unique flavors of Cincinnati Chili, a delightful blend of spices and ingredients that will warm your heart and satisfy your cravings. Perfect for family gatherings, this dish is both comforting and easy to prepare.
ingredients: 1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, brown the ground beef over medium heat, breaking it apart as it cooks.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, cooking until the onion is translucent.
Stir in the chili powder, cumin, paprika, and cinnamon, cooking for an additional minute to release the spices' aromas.
Pour in the tomato sauce, beef broth, and Worcestershire sauce, stirring to combine.
Season with salt and pepper, then bring the mixture to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and let it simmer uncovered for about 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the kidney beans in the last 10 minutes of cooking.
Serve over cooked spaghetti and top with shredded cheddar cheese and chopped onions.
tips: For the best flavor, allow the chili to rest for a few hours or overnight before serving. This will enhance the taste as the spices meld together.

structured_content.content: Cincinnati Chili is a beloved dish that stands out with its unique blend of spices and the unexpected addition of chocolate and cinnamon. This dish is a staple in Cincinnati, often served over spaghetti, and is sure to impress your family and friends with its rich flavors.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 60 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for weeknight dinners or entertaining
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Can be made ahead and tastes even better the next day

structured_content.content: Growing up, Cincinnati Chili was a family favorite, often served during gatherings and celebrations. The aroma of the spices simmering on the stove always brought everyone to the kitchen, eager to dig in.

• Main ingredient: Ground beef is traditional, but you can substitute with turkey or a plant-based option for a lighter version.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: The combination of chili powder, cumin, and cinnamon gives Cincinnati Chili its distinctive flavor profile.
  • Supporting ingredients: Tomato sauce and beef broth create a rich base, while kidney beans add texture and heartiness.
  • Equipment needed: A large pot or Dutch oven is essential for even cooking and flavor development.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by browning the ground beef in a large pot, then add onions and garlic until softened.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Mix in the spices and liquids, allowing the chili to simmer for at least 30 minutes for the best flavor.
Finishing Touches:
Serve the chili over spaghetti and garnish with cheese and onions for a classic presentation.

upload.context: A step-by-step visual of the cooking process for Cincinnati Chili.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Simmering the chili longer enhances the flavors, so don't rush this step.
  • Avoid overcooking the ground beef to keep it tender.
  • Look for a thickened sauce as an indicator that the chili is ready.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: Sharing Cincinnati Chili with friends and family has always been a joy, as everyone gathers around the table to enjoy this comforting dish together.
Enhance your Cincinnati Chili with a dash of hot sauce, fresh herbs, or by adding diced bell peppers for extra crunch.
Pair with a side salad or garlic bread for a complete meal, and serve with a cold beverage for a refreshing contrast.
For a vegetarian version, use lentils or a meat substitute, and for a gluten-free option, serve the chili over rice instead of spaghetti.

upload.context: A beautifully plated Cincinnati Chili ready to be served, showcasing its rich colors and textures.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use a mix of ground meats for a richer flavor.
  • Let the chili sit overnight for the best taste.
  • Keep an eye on the simmering time to avoid burning.
  • Garnish generously for an appealing presentation.

structured_content.content: Don't hesitate to try making Cincinnati Chili at home; the satisfaction of creating this dish will bring joy to your cooking experience!
